column5: Oct. 31 (Xinhua) – A Phnom Penh Municipal Court judge
column6: sentenced 26-year-old YUAN TANG (Thang Yien) to two years in prison (suspended)
column7: and a fine of 4 million Riels.------The court also ordered the compensation to families of the victims of $14
column8: 000. The decision was made after the panel opened in the evening of October 31
column9: 2018 in front of the defendant Thang Yien.------On August 16
column11: the Inquiry Commission of the Phnom Penh Court of First Instance
column13: issued a verdict to detain the Chinese woman after a crash caused death and injuries. She was sent to PJ Prison. ------During the prosecution case
column14: the Chinese woman was sued by Ms. Va Sakada
column15: deputy prosecutor of the Phnom Penh Municipal Court prosecuting three charges
column16: including: Intentional violence with aggravating circumstances
column18: under Articles 218 and Article 224 of the Penal Code and driving without proper driving license under Article 75 of the Law on Road Traffic.------The incident happened on 123rd Street
column24: 2018.------The victims were accused of stealing the woman’s phone
column25: when she ran them down on their Honda Scoopy in her car.------TD NEWS------
